main event: A single white, yellow, red object was observed standing still in the sky over Sulphur Grove, Ohio on March 7, 1953 at 6:35 PM.
interesting points: The object was described as a single 'white, yellow, red object'.
The object seemed to be standing still in the sky when observed.
The witness, William A. Boyle, was asked a series of detailed questions about the sighting, including the direction he was facing, weather conditions, and the object's movements and appearance.
The witness was asked to estimate the size, distance, and speed of the object, though the level of certainty is not clear.
The witness was asked whether the object displayed any unusual behaviors like changing direction, speed, size, or color, to which the response was 'Yes', 'No', or 'Don't know'.
